wjhk.jupload
Class PicturePanel

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Canvas
          wjhk.jupload.PicturePanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
javax.accessibility.Accessible, java.util.EventListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.awt.event.MouseListener, java.io.Serializable
Direct Known Subclasses:
DialogPicturePanel
public class PicturePanel
extends java.awt.Canvas
implements java.awt.event.MouseListener

This panel is used to preview picture, when PictureUploadPolicy (or one of its inherited policy) is used. Manages the panel where pictures are displayed.
Each time a user selects a file in the panel file, the PictureUploadPolicy calls setPictureFile(PictureFileData). I did an attempt to store the Image generated for the Panel size into the PictureFileData, to avoid to calculate the offscreenPicture each time the user select the same file again. But it doesn't work: the applet quickly runs out of memory, even after numerous calls of System.gc and finalize.

This file is taken from the PictureApplet ((C) 2002 Guillaume Chamberland-Larose), available here: To contact Guillaume Chamberland-Larose for bugs, patches, suggestions: Please use the forums on the sourceforge web page for this project, located at: http://sourceforge.net/projects/picture-applet/ Updated : 2006 Etienne Gauthier

Field Detail

mainContainer

private java.awt.Container mainContainer

pictureFileData

private PictureFileData pictureFileData

pictureDialog

PictureDialog pictureDialog
pictureDialog contains the current opened PictureDialog. Thid dialog is used to display the picture as big as the screen allowed it. If a new picture is to be viewed in big size, the current PictureDialog (if any) is used again.

offscreenImage

private java.awt.Image offscreenImage
offscreenImage contains an image, that can be asked by PictureFileData.getImage(Canvas, boolean). It is used to preview this picture.

hasToStoreOffscreenPicture

private boolean hasToStoreOffscreenPicture
Indicates if the offscreen image should be calculated once and stored, to avoid to calculate it again.
Indications: the offscreen image should be calculate only once for the picturePanel on the applet, and for each display when the user ask to display the fulscreen picture (by a click on the picturePanel).

picturePanelCursor

private java.awt.Cursor picturePanelCursor
That cursor which is displayed when the mouse is over this panel. The cursor can be changer to wait cursor, when long treatments are done, like loading a new picture.

Constructor Detail

PicturePanel

public PicturePanel(java.awt.Container mainContainer,
                    boolean hasToStoreOffscreenPicture)
Standard constructor.

Parameters:
mainContainer - The main panel of the current window. It can be used to change the displayed cursor (to a WAIT_CURSOR for instance)
Method Detail

setPictureFile

public void setPictureFile(PictureFileData pictureFileData)
This setter is called by PictureFileData to set the picture that is to be previewed.

Parameters:
pictureFileData - The FileData for the image to be displayed. Null if no picture should be displayed.

paint

public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)

rotate

public void rotate(int quarter)
This function is used to rotate the picture.

Parameters:
quarter - Number of quarters (90°) the picture should rotate. 1 means rotating of 90° clockwise (?). Can be negative.

calculateOffscreenImage

private void calculateOffscreenImage()
This method get the offscreenImage from the current pictureFileData. This image is null, if pictureFileData is null. In this case, the repaint will only clear the panel rectangle, on the screen.
